fields.summary: Investigate STP topology change while launching a new docker container

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
While creating the current network setup with Openvswitch and making it a mesh network I noticed that every time we launch a docker container it triggers an STP topology change. It's understandable when we add a new VM to the mesh, but not when we launch a container, since it involves a brief time in which we may lose connectivity while they are learning routes.

(x) Investigate alternative setup that avoid triggering an STP topology change every time we launch a Docker instance.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: Find a way to automate the web content approval process

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
Dear Jesus,

As discussed we need to find a way to automate the web content approval process.

You can find the draft of the process here: https://centralway.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=83199883

What we would like to have implemented is:
1. When someone changes the content on Writrs a tickets get automatically created to either Dean (is the content changed is in English) or to Marcus (if the content changed is in German).
2. In the ticket there should be a link to the file edited so that the guys can easily see and edit the content.
3. The ticket could be forwarded to other people for further approval.
4. When the ticket is closed the edited content should be pushed to production.

Please let me know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Thanks

fields.summary: Online "Get in Touch" Form Suggested Articles does not work as intented

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When going to the support.numbrs.com page and navigating to "Get in Touch". The feedback form is not working correctly. First of all it displays German FAQ articles when being on the English page, also the suggested articles' links are broken, so users cannot click on them anymore to get to the respective FAQ articles.

Additionally the labels are sometimes in German, namely Betreff (topic) and Beschreibung (description), on the English page. I attached a screenshot for clarity.

Please fix this issue, so that the support form again works as intended.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
From now own every candidate has to solve a task during his Meet CW. The task should be "unsolvable". By letting the candidate work on an unsolvable task the candidate will be stressed and the line manager and team will be able to see how he tackles difficult problems and how he behaves in situations that are out of his comfort zone. Please read the process and create a task for this position.

https://centralway.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CWHR/Process+Task+Meet+CW

fields.summary: Documenting Testrs Checklist and Post-Release Checklist

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
After executing a full build on the project, a bunch of tasks that shouldn't be part of the full build, need to be documented. Testrs should run against the project after it's published to see the quality of the same.

Post-Release Tasks
(x) Submitting sitemap.xml to Webmasters

Testrs Tasks
(x) Ensuring gzip headers for all non image/video files.
(x) Ensure cache-headers are correct and expires are for two years.
(x) Ensure css and js are minified
(x) Ensure concat is done to all scripts
(x) Ensure analytics is embedded directly not through external files
(x) Ensure bower components are added on request through min-blocks and not manually
(x) Make sure all scripts are uglified
(x) Evaluate ungruntcss for specific cases
(x) Spoof the headers of all our http requests and ensure a last-modified header is being provided.
(x) Generate all AJAX Urls as snapshots, add them in the Sitemap and modify nginx to point the redirect to it
(x) Ensuring analytics is present.
(x) Ensure all PNG images are interlaced.
(x) SEO Tasks: Ensure all pages have canonical urls, meta tags and titles. Evaluate through a set of rules which can be ran against a webpage to ensure they have everything that it's needed.
(x) Ensure mobile images are present for mobile, and WebP images are present

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
In Q1 a list of 44 bugs were created to track the imperfections of the Webpages. As the a redesign is coming, we want to ensure this issues are handled within production and not production.

In order to ensure this doesn't happen again, the 44 bugs were give a label “Q1_BugsReview”. After the redesign, this ticket will be used to track the work in order to review the redesign and ensuring none of the 44 bugs are present.

cc [~rogge]

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.

fields.description:
More information at: https://centralway.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CWCOM/Trackrs+-+Analytics+and+Performance+Monitoring

Since Geckoboard is insufficient to display the metrics related to our tests and builds, we will create a small wrapper of a Dashboard that can update the frame inside of it every 3 minutes, and display that in the Web Room.

(x) Add centralway/trackrs, provide wrapper code and tests.
(x) Integrate performance dashboard (Speedcurve)
(x) Integrate quality dashboard (Repo-insights, Jenkins)
(x) Integrate progress dashboard (JIRA Sprint View)

fields.summary: Open Source blurOverlayPopup

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
This is the code we use to do iOS7 style overlays:
https://github.com/centralway/blurOverlayPopup

As this isn't core to our business, and is useful to other developers, it is a good candidate for Open Sourcing.

Code follows our quality guidelines and can establish our reputation amongst the Front End Development Community.

In addition, publishing to npm would simplify our internal development.

Open sourcing simply requires adding a license and marking the repo as public.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: Web - Atlassian Self-Hosted Consistency Tests

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
Background:
The Cloud has begun testing our own self-hosted Atlassian suite in the Centralway data center. A backup of recent Atlassian data (Jira & Confluence) has been loaded onto this self-hosted Atlassian suite. Before we switch all employees to a self-hosted environment a series of consistency checks will need to be performed by each Team Lead.

Ticket Task:
Beginning in Week 30 you will be able to login into our own Atlassian server for consistency check of your teams data. Your login credentials are the same as your current Atlassian Login.

Login URL: https://jira.cwc.io

Please check:
-your login and access is identical to our current environment
-you have the functionality you and your team require
-your teams tickets and wikis display correctly with the correct data* 
-you can create, edit, link and delete content without issue

*data was loaded from a backup made in the end of Week 28

Please resolve this ticket after you are satisfied with your own testing.
A full rollout of this self-hosted environment is planned in the next few weeks.

Your comments are welcome. If you have any problems please contact the Cloud or comment [~brian.clampet] below.

fields.summary: Atlassian Production stage - Check JIRA+Confluence consistency

fields.summary: Setup Proxy Server to avoid usage of Third Party for Mailchimp subscription

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
Background story for this ticket: when the TV campaign came, we realised a little bit too late that mailchimp JSONP endpoint couldn't be used for subscribing due SSL (different domains). Thus, we implemented an endpoint through an external provider that [~jose.perez] personally owns. The downsides are clear: a) a third party provider can go down at any moment (no downtime however so far) b) The owner of the credentials is José, which presents a dependency for this feature of the webpage.

The client can be changed at any time to point to another server, which this time will be ours. The task is to create this proxy server that will allow us to connect and subscribe to Mailchimp.

cc [~ruflin]

fields.summary: Create a report for HR to evaluate success of job boards

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
Please create a report for the HR department that would track:

- incoming traffic to the CW website in the chosen time period
- number of visitors from each website who also fill a job application (!)

The goal is to help us evaluate our job boards and identify the most successful ones for our postings.

Ideally the report would be accessible and automatically updated at any time. If that is not possible, please do a monthly report at the beginning of each month, with data from the past month.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open
